intro: Pimpinella alpina, commonly known as alpine cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Pimpinella alpina is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
